items.title: Merry Christmas 2025: Wishes, Greetings, Quotes, Images, Facebook And WhatsApp Status
items.summary: As Christmas 2025 arrives, here are some warm Merry Christmas wishes filled with hope, gratitude, and a renewed sense of togetherness.

items.title: Banks seek certification on source of overseas transfers
items.summary: High-street banks are now demanding testimonials on 'sources of funds' from wealthy Indians, NRIs, and businesses looking to move money abroad. This comes as the rupee's slide against the US dollar tempts individuals to remit funds overseas, with banks insisting on CA validation for these transactions.

items.title: Embassy REIT's ₹530-crore deal
items.summary: Mumbai Embassy Office Parks REIT has sold two blocks at its Embassy Manyata Business Park in Bengaluru. The deal, valued at ₹530 crore, involved approximately 376,000 sq ft. EAAA Alternatives' Rental Yield Plus fund acquired the properties.

items.title: Hillhouse joins Temasek in race for up to 6% stake in Quest Global
items.summary: Hillhouse Investment Management is vying with Temasek for a stake in Quest Global. The deal is valued at approximately $4.5 billion. This investment is part of Quest Global's pre-IPO fundraising. A decision on the new investor is expected soon. Quest Global is preparing for a potential IPO and may relocate its headquarters to Bengaluru.

items.title: Pubs, eateries expect nights to be longer this time: Year-end lift with more 24-hour outlets & new menus, cos eye 15-20% rise in sales
items.summary: Restaurants and bars are preparing for a busy holiday season. Many are extending operating hours and introducing new menus. Businesses anticipate a significant sales boost, with some expecting up to a 20% increase compared to last year. Extended timings are being permitted in some regions to accommodate the festive demand.

items.title: Govt proactively addressing consumer complaints on 'innovative' dark patterns: Pralhad Joshi
items.summary: India's Consumer Affairs Ministry is tackling deceptive online designs. Minister Pralhad Joshi highlighted efforts against 'dark patterns' that trick users. Guidelines were issued to regulate these practices. The ministry is actively handling new complaints. Digital justice platforms like e-Jagriti are speeding up case disposal, with over 1.4 lakh cases resolved.

items.title: Navi Mumbai Airport to take off today
items.summary: Navi Mumbai International Airport commences operations on Thursday. Thirty flights will connect to nine domestic cities. IndiGo, Air India Express, Akasa Air, and Star Air will operate services. Over 4,000 passengers are expected on the opening day. The airport will initially operate from 8 AM to 8 PM. Round-the-clock services are planned from February 2026.

items.title: Sequent-Viyash may soon have zero debt: Viyash founder and combined co's CEO-designate Hari Babu Bodepudi to inject ₹400 crore
items.summary: Hari Babu Bodepudi is making a significant capital infusion into the newly merged Sequent Scientific and Viyash Life Sciences. This strategic investment will effectively reduce the combined company's net debt to nearly zero. Under Carlyle's leadership, the newly formed entity is poised to surpass a market capitalization of $1 billion.

items.title: CESL concludes largest mega tenders for 10,900 e-buses under PM E-Drive Scheme
items.summary: Convergence Energy Services Ltd has successfully completed a large tender for 10,900 electric buses. This initiative under the PM E-Drive Scheme saw significant industry participation. The procured buses will be deployed across major cities like Bengaluru and Delhi. This move aims to boost public transport and reduce pollution. Private operators will manage operations and maintenance.

items.title: Winter has yet to wear its jackets and sweaters: Mild season in North India may hit apparel sales by 25%
items.summary: North India experienced an early winter, but sales for cold-weather clothing remain sluggish. Retailers face higher inventories as temperatures have not dropped significantly. Consumers are delaying purchases, anticipating discounts. This trend is impacting winter wear demand and sales for apparel chains across key markets. The season is crucial for the industry's revenue.

items.title: Credit card spending cools to pre-festive levels in Nov
items.summary: Credit card spending in Mumbai saw an 11% dip in November, returning to pre-festive levels at ₹1.90 lakh crore, though still up 12% year-on-year. Despite this, new card issuances rose, with HDFC Bank leading additions. Analysts attribute the spending slowdown to post-GST normalization and cautious consumer behavior, expecting a mid-single-digit growth ahead.

items.title: Post- auction, Aviom India Housing Finance promoter tables a full settlement plan
items.summary: Aviom India Housing Finance promoter Kajal Ilmi has submitted a revised settlement offer of ₹554 crore upfront, aiming to repay lenders and withdraw bankruptcy proceedings. This comes after Unity Small Finance Bank emerged as the winning bidder in a challenge auction for the company. The proposal includes an equity infusion and aims to maximize value for stakeholders.

items.title: Centre cracks down on ‘dark patterns’ misleading online users; 26 firms commit to compliance
items.summary: Dark patterns are clever but misleading design tricks used by websites and apps to push users into doing things they might not really want—like signing up for unwanted subscriptions or paying hidden fees.

items.title: Big brands want a ticket to get on the gravy train
items.summary: Leading global and Indian food chains are seeking details on opening premium outlets at railway stations, anticipating higher sales potential than airports.  The Indian Railways amended its catering policy to allow established brands like McDonald's and Haldiram's, with the first outlets expected in 2026, aiming to enhance passenger experience and boost non-fare revenue.

items.title: Reliance resumes Russian oil imports
items.summary: Reliance Industries has restarted buying discounted Russian crude oil. The company is sourcing barrels from suppliers not under sanctions. These shipments are heading to its refinery in Gujarat. This move is expected to limit a drop in India's overall Russian oil imports this month. Reliance had paused purchases after US sanctions were imposed on Russian producers.

items.title: Can't invalidate agreements at Arshiya trade zone: NCLT
items.summary: The National Company Law Tribunal has refused to reopen long-standing commercial agreements at Arshiya Panvel free trade and warehousing zone. The tribunal ruled that these arrangements, signed years before insolvency proceedings, cannot be challenged. This decision allows the original contracts with Ascendas Panvel FTWZ to continue as executed.

items.title: Budget 2026: Industry seeks faster tax dispute resolution
items.summary: Businesses are pushing the government to fix tax uncertainties and speed up dispute resolution. Unclear rules and treaty issues could lead to more tax cases. Industry leaders want the budget to cut litigation and reform Tax Deducted at Source. A large number of appeals are pending, causing delays.

items.title: India assures safeguards in place on New Zealand apple imports
items.summary: India has granted New Zealand market access for apples under a new trade pact. The agreement includes safeguards to protect local farmers. A concessional duty applies only to a specific quota. Imports beyond this quota will face the full existing duty.

items.title: Lower, fixed transaction fee for power exchanges in the works
items.summary: India's electricity regulator is reviewing power exchange transaction fees.  A fixed fee of 1.5 paise per unit is being discussed for most trades.  Lower fees for longer-term contracts are also under consideration.  This move aims for greater transparency and predictability for market participants.  The regulator is also planning market coupling from 2026.  This could benefit smaller exchanges.

items.title: GI tag, carbon tax & intellectual property rights on top for India in January trade talks with EU
items.summary: India and the European Union are set for crucial trade talks in early January. Discussions will cover geographical indications, critical mineral exports, and the EU's carbon border adjustment mechanism. India's steel export concerns are also on the agenda. Officials are working towards a swift agreement.

items.title: Sebi gives its go-ahead to road ministry’s proposed public InvIT
items.summary: SEBI has approved NHAI's Raajmarg Infra Investment Trust (RIIT), a public InvIT designed to monetize national highway assets and offer retail investors a stake in infrastructure growth. The first issuance is expected in February 2026, with 1,500 km of highways to be introduced over the next three to five years, fostering public participation in national development.

items.title: After cancellations & delays for days, IndiGo says fully prepared to cater to holiday season demand

items.summary: India’s manufacturing sector underperforms compared to China and South Korea, partly due to public sector wages that raise costs and reduce competitiveness; despite growth in private industries like software and services, India sees limited technological upgrading, uneven wage growth, and increasing inequality

This achievement under the PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojna highlights Gujarat's leadership. The state continues to be the nation's frontrunner in rooftop solar installations. Citizen-friendly policies have made solar adoption accessible and affordable for all.

A brief spike in late September is seen as temporary, prompting the firm to warn of a possible 15–20 per cent downside.

We look forward to using these aircraft to connect Delhi and Mumbai with Athens starting 23 January 2026, as previously announced," IndiGo Spokesperson said.

items.title: PNB Housing bounces back after CEO shock—growth and asset quality in focus
items.summary: After an 18% stock drop following the sudden CEO exit, PNB Housing has regained investor confidence with stronger asset quality and steady growth, but rising risks in the affordable housing segment could test the recovery.

items.title: Multibaggers: 12 smallcap stocks gained over 50% every year for 3 years, surging 500%-1,450%
items.summary: The market script took an unexpected twist in CY25. While the Sensex marched ahead confidently, gaining 9.5%, the BSE Smallcap Index stumbled, slipping 6.5% over the same period. For smallcap investors, it felt like the music had suddenly stopped. But this short-term pain hides a much bigger story.

items.title: Penny stock under  ₹5: Steel stock jumps up to 14% after product launch; profit margin to benefit 20%
items.summary: Penny stock under  ₹5: In an exchange filing, Ganga Forging announced that the company has entered into the Elastic Rail Clip segment, a critical railway track fastening component used by Indian Railways.

items.title: Small cap stock Vikran Engineering jumps over 15% in biggest 1-day spike since listing on  ₹2,035 crore order win
items.summary: Vikran Engineering's share price surged 15.40% to  ₹100 after securing a  ₹2,035.26 crore order for solar projects in Maharashtra. This order represents 95% of the company's market cap and enhances its renewable energy portfolio, reflecting strong momentum in their EPC business.

items.title: Castrol India shares surge 9% after BP announces 65% stake sale in parent for $6 billion
items.summary: Castrol India share price surged 9% after BP announced the sale of a 65% stake in Castrol Limited to Stonepeak at an enterprise value of $10.1 billion. The transaction, expected to close by end-2026, is part of bp’s strategic divestment programme aimed at strengthening its balance sheet while retaining exposure to Castrol’s growth through a 35% stake.

items.title: Household income survey 2026: Why we need to tackle a data blind spot on what Indian homes earn
items.summary: For decades, India has used household spending—not earnings—as an input for analysis and policy formulation. Income is very difficult to measure accurately. But the ministry of statistics has a national survey in the works that promises to close a glaring gap.

items.title: Soothe Healthcare partners with Japan's Osaki Medical for feminine hygiene, baby care products
items.summary: Soothe Healthcare and Osaki Medical Corporation have joined forces. This collaboration will bring Japanese feminine hygiene, maternity, and baby care products to India. Initially, these items will be imported. The companies plan to start local manufacturing later. This move aims to meet the growing demand for quality products in India's women's care market.

items.title: Budget 2026: Fiscal consolidation in focus as India targets leaner deficit
items.summary: The next Union Budget will continue India’s Viksit Bharat agenda, focusing on growth, inclusion and sustainability, said EAC-PM chairman S Mahendra Dev. The government will stick to fiscal consolidation, with the fiscal deficit on track to fall below 4.5% of GDP and debt levels declining.

items.title: Vikran Engineering bags Rs 2,000 crore solar projects order in Maharashtra
items.summary: Vikran Engineering secured a significant order worth over Rs 2,000 crore. The company will develop 600 MW solar projects across Maharashtra. This turnkey EPC project will be executed over 12 months. The scope includes design, engineering, procurement, and commissioning. Key components like solar PV modules and inverters will be supplied.

items.title: Zombie ship shows Trump is targeting darkest corner of oil fleet
items.summary: A 27-year-old tanker, believed to be a 'zombie vessel' using a scrapped ship's identity, is heading to Venezuela. This tactic helps Venezuela, crippled by sanctions, export its oil, primarily to China. Despite a fraction of its former output, Venezuela's continued shipments are prompting the US to pursue physical disruption of its oil trade.

items.title: After gold’s big year, can equities steal the spotlight again in 2026? Dipan Mehta answers
items.summary: After gold’s surprise rally in 2025, equities could regain leadership in 2026, says Dipan Mehta, Director at Elixir Equities. Small- and mid-cap stocks look better placed as earnings catch up and valuations normalise. Metals, autos, ports and select NBFCs remain key themes, while asset-class leadership may rotate again next year.

items.title: Platinum soars to record high amid frenzy in precious metals, gains twice as much as gold in 2025
items.summary: Platinum reached a record high of $2,378 per ounce, driven by geopolitical tensions and a weakening US dollar. The metal has surged 162% this year, marking its longest winning streak since 2017, alongside strong demand from investors and tight supply conditions.

items.title: Nifty IT up 6% in 1 month: Will AI-led momentum power a revival in Indian IT stocks in 2026?
items.summary: Indian IT stocks are regaining investor interest, with the Nifty IT index rising over 6% in a month due to AI revenue visibility and improved US demand. Despite past underperformance, optimism is returning, although challenges like visa restrictions remain.

items.title: Claims lack consistency and context, says Arul Selvan D on Chola allegations
items.summary: Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company (Chola) has refuted allegations of financial impropriety, asserting that all past transactions adhered to prevailing laws and regulatory frameworks. Management clarified that disclosures and fund diversions, including insurance transactions and payments to family members, were conducted with business rationale and proper approvals, emphasizing that current norms should not be retroactively applied.

items.title: Kajaria Ceramics fraud disclosure raises corporate governance concerns
items.summary: Kajaria Ceramics' stock has declined 14% so far in 2025, and a repeat of any such fraud in the company in future could lead to a de-rating

items.title: Budget should focus on widening tax base, investment incentive to further bolster growth: Report
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 should prioritise expanding the direct tax base and encouraging private investment. Freezing peak tax rates will boost growth and create jobs. Reforms should extend GST principles to direct taxes, focusing on policy certainty and compliance. Technology will drive base expansion, not rate hikes. Incentives will channel profits into productive assets, fostering manufacturing and R&D.

items.title: India’s economic numbers are getting an upgrade: What’s changing, why it matters, and what the Centre wants
items.summary: India is overhauling its economic measurement systems, incorporating online prices and real-time data to improve inflation, industrial output, and GDP figures. These changes follow an IMF 'C' grade for national accounts, aiming for greater accuracy and representation of the modern economy.

items.title: Newly listed small-cap stock Oswal Pumps jumps 4% after receiving a letter of empanelment from MSEDCL
items.summary: Oswal Pumps announced it had received a letter of empanelment from Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) for a  ₹180 crore project under PM KUSUM-B.

items.title: Power PSUs weigh exit from debt-laden energy-efficiency venture as stress mounts
items.summary: Promoters of Energy Efficiency Services Ltd are considering a public listing of the company, which has outstanding dues of over  ₹4,000 crore. While the company navigates its debt and cash flow challenges, experts suggest that government backing could attract investors.&nbsp;

items.title: What is friendshoring? Why Ernst & Young says it will reshape global supply chains in 2026
items.summary: What is friendshoring? As tariffs intensify, export controls expand, and geopolitics increasingly infiltrate supply chains, a new trade order centred on selective partnerships is emerging.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 flat ahead of Christmas holiday, IT stocks slip on H-1B visa lottery rule changes
items.summary: Hindalco, Shriram Finance, Apollo Hospitals, Trent and Max Healthcare led Nifty 50, while Dr Reddy’s, Wipro, Sun Pharma, IndiGo and Reliance were top losers

items.title: BP to sell 65% stake in Castrol to Stonepeak for $6 billion
items.summary: BP is selling a major part of its Castrol lubricants business to Stonepeak for approximately $6 billion. This deal values Castrol at $10.1 billion. BP will keep a 35% stake in a new joint venture. The funds will help BP reduce its debt. This is a key step in BP's plan to sell assets and improve profitability.

items.title: Bitcoin slips below $88K as holiday trading dries up liquidity. Should you brace for a breakout or breakdown?
items.summary: Bitcoin slipped below $88,000 amid thin holiday trading, with low liquidity amplifying modest sentiment shifts and increasing volatility risks. Profit booking and easing derivatives positions have kept prices range-bound, reflecting cautious market conviction rather than a strong bearish trend.

items.title: From paper wealth to real money: How startup IPOs shaped Esop exits in 2025
items.summary: While Esop buybacks stayed muted amid the funding winter, public markets emerged as the most meaningful and scalable liquidity avenue for startup employees

items.title: Nifty 50 seen scaling 30,000 in 2026 on bull-market correction & strong technical signals: Report
items.summary: The benchmark Nifty 50 index is likely to scale the 30,000 mark in calendar year 2026, supported by strong technical indicators and historical price behaviour, according to a research report by ICICI Direct.

items.title: Gold and silver grab attention, but platinum’s 140% rally in 2025 is turning heads
items.summary: Platinum has emerged as the standout precious metal of 2025, sharply outperforming gold and silver amid supply deficits, rising investment flows and strong industrial demand. Persistent production challenges, expanding Chinese participation and macro tailwinds have propelled prices to record highs, reshaping investor perceptions and reviving interest in platinum’s role within diversified portfolios.

items.title: Is Indian stock market closed tomorrow for Christmas 2025?
items.summary: The Indian stock market will be closed on December 25 for Christmas, marking its only holiday in December. Trading will resume on December 26, 2025. Despite a muted market trend, analysts remain optimistic about recovery and improving earnings visibility in Indian equities.

items.title: South Korean won rebounds sharply from 8-month lows on pension fund support
items.summary: SOUTHKOREA-MARKETS/CLOSE:South Korean won rebounds sharply from 8-month lows on pension fund support

items.title: Rebounding yen sinks Japan stocks despite chip share rally
items.summary: JAPAN-STOCKS/CLOSE:Rebounding yen sinks Japan stocks despite chip share rally

items.title: WhatsApp’s data-sharing case: Antitrust action has sent Big Tech a big message on privacy
items.summary: Meta was hauled up by India’s competition regulator for WhatsApp’s 2021 take-it-or-leave-it revision of privacy policy. Tribunal rulings have confirmed abuse of dominance. India’s privacy law is yet to take effect but Meta was reined in. From here on, the CCI and DPA need to keep a joint vigil.

items.title: JBM Auto share price surges 12% in a lacklustre stock market; can it rise more? Here's what tech charts reveal
items.summary: JBM Auto share price opened at  ₹593.75 against its previous close of  ₹577.90 and jumped 11.6% to an intraday high of  ₹645. Around 12:15 pm, the stock was 10.26% up at  ₹637.20. Equity benchmark Sensex was flat at 85,544 at that time.

items.title: Safety, strain and scale: How 2025 tested the Indian aviation’s flight
items.summary: India's aviation sector, poised for growth, faced significant operational strains and safety concerns in 2025. A deadly crash, widespread flight cancellations due to new pilot rules, and GPS spoofing incidents tested the industry. Despite robust passenger demand and infrastructure expansion, profitability remained elusive, highlighting the need for improved safety oversight and resilience.

items.title: Health(y) Inc: Top private hospitals see spurt in per-bed revenue
items.summary: India's leading private hospitals are experiencing a significant revenue surge per bed, driven by advanced high-tech treatments and increased insurance coverage. This trend, reflected in 2024-25 data, shows a 23% rise in average daily revenue per bed, indicating a broader shift towards specialized and expensive medical procedures becoming more accessible to patients.

items.title: 'The silver story is just beginning': Vedanta's Anil Agarwal on why silver rally is not just precious, but functional
items.summary: Silver’s powerful rally in 2025 has put the metal firmly in the spotlight, with prices far outpacing gold. Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal said silver has exited gold’s shadow and entered a long-term structural phase.

items.title: Small-cap AI stock jumps after MoU for Semiconductor development. Details here
items.summary: Blue Cloud Softech Solutions share prices rises 3% to  ₹25.20 after announcing a partnership with ConnectM for developing an automotive semiconductor-based EdgeAI SoC. The collaboration aims to enhance cybersecurity in vehicles and is projected to generate USD 50 million in revenue.

items.title: Indian equities look to earnings-led growth in 2026
items.summary: Market participants expect the coming year to be driven less by broad-based re-rating and more by earnings delivery, domestic liquidity support and selective sectoral opportunities, even as global uncertainties linger

items.title: Groww shares soar 9% with the stock up 76% from issue price. What’s fuelling the rally?
items.summary: Groww shares jump 9.5% as investors cheer the stock’s upcoming BSE Large Cap index inclusion and the launch of its emergency trading platform, Groww Lite. The stock has surged 75.6% since its Rs 100 IPO.

items.title: Sanction-hit Nayara delays oil refinery maintenance work
items.summary: The private refiner will delay planned works and the closure of its 4,00,000 barrels-a-day complex from February until April 2026, say sources

items.title: Investment pledges surge, jute and tea sectors under strain in West Bengal
items.summary: West Bengal's economy in 2025 experienced significant investment in ports, power, and technology. Major companies pledged substantial funds for new projects. This growth occurred alongside challenges in traditional sectors like jute and tea. The state government expressed confidence in its economic direction. Fiscal matters remained a point of political discussion.

items.title: IFSCA eases employee-cap for GHCs & scraps office space rule for BAFT
items.summary: Under the earlier IFSCA GIC framework, the 20% cap applied to the transfer of employees from locations in India (domestic entities) to GIFT IFSC

items.title: India to beat consensus growth estimates, Goldman Sachs predicts 6.7% growth in 2026 and 6.8% in 2027
items.summary: Global economic growth is set for resilience in 2026. India will lead as a fast-growing economy. Goldman Sachs forecasts 2.8% global growth, with India at 6.7%. Emerging markets will outperform developed nations. Strong domestic demand and infrastructure spending fuel India's rise. Inflation is expected to ease, supporting growth. Global labor market weakness is a noted risk.

items.title: Coal India subsidiary IPOs could boost shareholder returns: Parthiv Jhonsa
items.summary: Coal India is set to unlock significant shareholder value with the upcoming listings of its major subsidiaries, BCCL, SECL, and MCL. Industry experts view this as a positive move, with MCL particularly noted for its operational efficiency. While holding company discounts are anticipated, the extent will depend on dilution levels and remaining subsidiaries.

items.title: One Trump move that never left India's concern list in 2025
items.summary: The India-US relationship, once envisioned as a natural alliance, has become unpredictable, oscillating between warmth and confrontation. Despite public bonhomie and early trade discussions, sharp trade actions and mixed geopolitical signals have strained ties, driven by domestic US politics and strategic interests.

items.title: Business events that shaped India in 2025
items.summary: From Trump’s trade war to RBI repo rate cuts and major corporate entries, 2025 delivered several notable developments. Though not all were transformational, a few deserve closer attention.

items.title: Gold hits record ₹1.38 lakh/10g in futures trade; tops ₹4,500/ounce in international markets
items.summary: Rallying for the third straight session, gold futures for February delivery increased by ₹791, or 0.57% to hit a lifetime high of ₹1,38,676 per 10 grams on MCX

items.title: Jupiter Wagons shares jump 35% in four days following promoter stake hike
items.summary: Jupiter Wagons shares surged over 35% in four days after promoter Tatravagonka A.S. increased its stake to 19.24% through convertible warrant conversion. The acquisition was completed on December 19 and disclosed the same day in compliance with SEBI’s insider trading regulations. The move boosted investor confidence, reflecting promoter faith in long-term growth.

items.title: L&T bags 'significant' electrification order for Mumbai Metro railway project
items.summary: Larsen & Toubro has secured a significant order for the Mumbai Metro Line 4 electrification project. The contract involves design, supply, installation, and commissioning of power and traction systems. L&T will also handle electrical and mechanical works for stations and depots. This marks a continued partnership in developing the Mumbai Metro corridor.

items.title: Office leasing up 6% in 2025 across top 7 cities on better demand from corporates
items.summary: Office space leasing in India's top cities has seen a significant rise. Demand increased by 6 percent to 71.5 million square feet this year. This growth is fueled by both domestic and foreign companies. Technology and BFSI sectors are expected to drive further demand. Global Capability Centers are a major contributor. Corporates are opting for both traditional and flexible workspaces.

items.title: FTAs to open overseas opportunities for Indian professionals: Commerce Secretary
India Inc sees first earnings upgrade after a gap of 5 quarters
items.summary: India Inc has recorded its first aggregate earnings upgrade in five quarters, driven by mid- and large-cap firms, signaling a turnaround in the corporate profit cycle. Motilal Oswal raised FY26 PAT estimates by 2% after a series of cuts over the previous four quarters, marking a clear inflection in earnings revisions.

items.title: India’s office market scales new peak in 2025; rentals rise, vacancies tighten
items.summary: India's office market achieved a record 71.5 million sq ft of Grade A leasing in 2025, a 6% year-on-year increase driven by strong occupier demand and expanding GCC footprints. Bengaluru led with 22.1 million sq ft, while a robust Q4 saw all-time high leasing of 20.6 million sq ft, signaling sustained confidence and a positive outlook for 2026.

items.title: India’s Rs 2.3 lakh cr REIT market emerges as global powerhouse, overtakes Hong Kong
items.summary: India’s REIT market has surged to a Rs 2.3 lakh crore scale, surpassing Hong Kong and emerging as a global powerhouse, ANAROCK Capital said. With five listed REITs, strong occupancies, robust yields, rising distributions and SEBI’s new equity reclassification, the sector is poised for accelerated growth and broader investor participation.

items.title: Jefferies initiates coverage on Pine Labs with Rs 300 target price. Here's why it sees 28% upside
items.summary: Jefferies has initiated coverage on Pine Labs with a Buy rating, citing an earnings inflection point, strong revenue growth prospects, and improving profitability. Expansion across digital payments and operating leverage could drive a potential valuation re-rating.

items.title: Below IPO price, anchor lock-ins for Citigroup-backed GK Energy and Saatvik Green end today
items.summary: Anchor lock-ins for GK Energy and Saatvik Green Energy end today, releasing over 8 million shares into the market. Both stocks have fallen below their IPO prices despite strong listings and high subscription levels. GK Energy’s IPO was subscribed 93.6 times, while Saatvik Green drew nearly 7 times the overall demand.

items.title: Coal India shares gain 3% to top Nifty 50 after board okays subsidiaries listing
items.summary: The stock traded at ₹408.85 with an increase of 2% and hitting an intraday high of ₹412.40, against the previous close of ₹400.40

items.title: India’s sanction-hit Nayara delays oil refinery maintenance work
items.summary: Nayara Energy has postponed maintenance at its 400,000 bpd Vadinar refinery from February to April 2026 as European contractors avoid working with the Rosneft-backed firm, sanctioned by the EU over Russia’s war in Ukraine. The sanctions have also stalled Nayara’s petrochemical projects. Meanwhile, the refinery continues processing Russia’s Urals crude after disruptions from Saudi and Iraqi suppliers.

items.title: AI data centres are forcing dirty ‘peaker’ power plants back into service
items.summary: The rarely-used eight-unit Fisk power plant owned by Houston-based NRG Energy was scheduled to retire next year, but then came AI

items.title: RVNL, IRCTC, Jupiter Wagons shares are running again. Should you ride railway stocks into the Union Budget?
items.summary: Railway stocks are back in focus as RVNL, IRCTC, Jupiter Wagons and other rail-linked names rally ahead of the Union Budget 2026. Investors are eyeing potential increases in railway allocations, but analysts caution that pre-Budget spikes may be short-lived without sustained fundamentals.

items.title: Global investors turn to Chinese AI stocks amid Wall Street valuation concerns
items.summary: Global investors are increasingly shifting capital to Chinese AI stocks as stretched U.S. tech valuations raise bubble concerns. Strong policy support, blockbuster chipmaker listings and China’s push for technological self-reliance are boosting interest, with firms like Alibaba, Baidu and Tencent emerging as key beneficiaries of the growing AI investment pivot.

items.title: 2026 Investment Outlook: Varun Saboo sees opportunity in financials, FMCG and Real Estate
items.summary: Varun Saboo of Anand Rathi Shares & Stock Brokers is optimistic about Indian markets for 2026, favoring BFSI and consumer sectors. He sees strong potential in nascent categories within FMCG and believes white goods offer long-term accumulation opportunities despite near-term weather impacts. Real estate also remains attractive due to robust demand and a continuing upcycle.

items.title: ESG and Wealth Preservation: How sustainable investing fits into HNI portfolios
items.summary: For HNIs, investing is increasingly focused on capital protection, risk management and long-term sustainability, not just returns. ESG investing has become a key framework globally, shaping how investors assess business quality and influencing capital allocation decisions among U.S. investors, Indian HNIs and family offices.

items.title: Rupee rises 12 paise to 89.51 against U.S. dollar in early trade
items.summary: Forex traders noted that the rupee opened stronger after the RBI announced about ₹3 lakh crore in liquidity for the markets, helping to control rupee weakness

items.title: Kerala MVD warns quick-commerce firms over rash driving by riders
items.summary: Kerala's Motor Vehicles Department has issued notices to quick-commerce platforms like Blinkit, Swiggy, Zepto, and Bigbasket, demanding policy overhauls within 15 days. This action follows a rise in traffic violations and reckless driving by delivery riders, driven by pressure for ultra-fast deliveries. The department stressed that public safety must not be compromised for commercial competition.

items.title: China clears Haier to dilute stake in India arm; Bharti–Warburg set to buy 49%: Sources
items.summary: Chinese government has reportedly approved Haier's sale of a 49% stake in its Indian arm, Haier Appliances India, to the Bharti Enterprises-Warburg Pincus combine. This strategic move aims to overcome regulatory hurdles and facilitate capital infusion for expansion. The deal, expected to be announced soon, values the Indian business at approximately $1.3-1.5 billion.

items.title: Hindustan Copper shares shoot up 17% in a week to their record high as copper prices rally
items.summary: Hindustan Copper share price hit a fresh all-time high as copper prices surged globally and domestically, driven by tightening supply, green energy demand and improving industrial outlook. Strong price momentum and operational leverage have kept the stock firmly in investor focus.

items.title: Spices Board cancels cardamomauction.com’s dealer licence
items.summary: Regulator advises auctioneers and growers to cease all transactions with the firm

items.title: Ahmedabad, Pune most affordable housing markets in 2025: Knight Frank report
items.summary: Housing affordability improved across major Indian cities in 2025, led by Ahmedabad, Pune and Kolkata, thanks to lower home loan rates, Knight Frank said. Mumbai saw affordability fall below the crucial 50% EMI-to-income mark for the first time, signalling a more sustainable environment for homebuyers amid strong demand.

items.title: As PE firms return to schools, Kedaara-backed K-12 Techno looks to raise $150-200 million
items.summary: The talks come amid renewed private equity interest in K-12 education, with investors increasingly favouring platform-led consolidation over backing individual school assets

items.title: Stock markets trade higher in early deals
items.summary: Stock markets rise early as BSE Sensex gains 115.8 points and NSE Nifty increases by 40.7 points amid positive global trends

items.title: Websol Energy System shares rally 14% after Rs 73 crore tax bombshell is defused
items.summary: Websol Energy System shares jumped as much as 14% after the company won a key tax appeal, with authorities setting aside a Rs 73.04 crore demand for FY18. The ruling removes a major contingent liability from the solar firm’s books, triggering a sharp relief rally despite the stock being down 46% so far in 2025.

items.title: Crude oil futures gain as Q3 data shows US economic growth
items.summary: At 9.56 am on Wednesday, February Brent oil futures were at $62.47, up 0.14% and February crude oil futures on WTI  were at $58.50, up 0.21%

items.title: Stock markets open flat ahead of Christmas closing
items.summary: The Sensex climbed 115.8 points to 85,640.64 in early trade and Nifty went up by 40.7 points to 26,217.85

items.title: Carnage-hit media stocks plunge up to 40% in 2025 but Ranbir Kapoor-backed scrip flashes Animal spirits
items.summary: The media sector is ending 2025 as a poor performer, with most Nifty Media index stocks experiencing double-digit declines. Prime Focus, however, stands out with significant gains. Analysts attribute the sector's struggles to a shift in consumer habits towards digital platforms and a lack of innovation in traditional media.

items.title: Rupee rises 12 paise to 89.51 against US dollar in early trade
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 89.56 against the US dollar, then gained some ground and touched 89.51 against the US dollar, registering a gain of 12 paise over its previous close

items.title: Vikran Engineering shares zoom 15% on Rs 2,035 crore solar EPC order win
items.summary: Vikran Engineering shares rose sharply on Wednesday after the company secured a Rs 2,035 crore EPC order from Onix Renewables for developing 600 MW AC solar projects in Maharashtra. The turnkey project, to be completed in 12 months, strengthens Vikran’s renewable energy portfolio and boosts its order book.

items.title: From funding winter to liquidity surge, 2025 marks turning point for Indian startups
items.summary: While overall funding volumes declined, the average median deal size nearly doubled to about $1.4 million in 2025, from roughly $700,000 in 2024, signalling greater investor selectivity and maturity

items.title: Jaw-dropping 15,594% return as Sensex turns 40: How the wealth creation engine exploded from 549 to 86,000
items.summary: The BSE Sensex has achieved remarkable wealth creation over four decades. It has grown from a modest start to a lifetime high, transforming into a democratized wealth engine for millions. This journey reflects India's economic transformation and its rise as a global powerhouse. The Sensex has become a true barometer of the Indian economy.

items.title: Sensex gains over 100 pts, Nifty tops 26,200 on US economic growth optimism
items.summary: Indian stocks edged higher on Wednesday, with the Sensex and Nifty steadying after a flat close. Stronger U.S. economic growth data boosted risk appetite, though foreign fund outflows and thin year-end trading volumes tempered the optimism.

items.title: Enterprise AI is maturing — will 2026 be the year it breaks free?
items.summary: The changes ahead, in 2026, will be less about bigger models and more about how intelligence is structured, verified, and distributed

items.title: Mukul Agrawal: The star investor who found 5 multibaggers in 2025 when others barely had any
items.summary: Despite a challenging market in 2025 that saw many portfolios decline, investor Mukul Agrawal's equity holdings featured five multibagger stocks. While his overall portfolio saw a slight dip, these select companies delivered significant returns, outperforming the broader market slump in small-cap stocks.

items.title: Falling crude prices, surplus services exports to keep India's CAD in comfort zone: Crisil
items.summary: The report stated that India's CAD is expected to remain in the comfort zone at an average of 1% of GDP in fiscal 2026, compared with 0.6% of GDP in fiscal 2025

items.title: Vietnam's stock market rises on signs of smooth power transition
items.summary: Vietnam's stock market hit a record high, extending its weekly rally as investors reacted positively to signs of political stability. A senior Communist Party meeting agreed on candidates for the next leadership, with party chief To Lam widely expected to retain his powerful post.

items.title: Cholamandalam Investment and Finance shares in focus after company rejects governance allegations, brokerages reiterate buy rating
items.summary: Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company shares are set to be in focus after the company rejected allegations of governance lapses, reaffirmed its guidance and highlighted strong liquidity and capital buffers. Brokerages including Motilal Oswal, Morgan Stanley and Jefferies reiterated their positive stance, citing improving disbursements and resilient fundamentals.

items.title: Taskforce suggests compulsory green building certification in Delhi
items.summary: According to the report of the joint government–industry taskforce formed by the lieutenant governor, absence of clear guidelines, regulations and frameworks hinders operationalisation of green incentives by builders and developers.

items.title: From coverage to assurance: Fixing India’s health system
items.summary: As India advances toward universal health coverage, strengthening primary care, health workforce capacity and medicine quality is critical to turn ambitious programmes into assured health outcomes.

items.title: India’s creator economy 2026: From commerce to contracts, a year of maturity
items.summary: As 2026 approaches, the industry is poised to enter a phase of strategic maturity and scale.

items.title: Farmer bodies seek global tech support for agriculture
items.summary: AIKCC and BKCC set to work closely with the Foundation for Critical Choices for India to gain technical expertise and exposure to advanced farming technologies from Holland

items.title: Goldman Sachs initiates coverage on PhysicsWallah, sets target price of Rs 135 backed by strong revenue, EBIDTA projection
items.summary: Goldman Sachs has initiated coverage on PhysicsWallah with a Neutral rating and a ₹135 target price, citing strong execution and a large market opportunity. It expects 24% revenue CAGR and over 80% EBITDA CAGR during FY25–30, driven by organic traffic, a stable competitive landscape, and a scalable pricing model.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc shares jump 4% as silver prices breach $72 mark, rally over 140% in 2025
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc shares: Silver prices hit record highs above $72/oz, up over 140% in 2025. The surge is driven by strong industrial demand, supply constraints, safe-haven buying, and expectations of looser US monetary policy, with MCX silver also touching fresh all-time highs in India.

items.title: NLC India among 7 stocks flashing bullish signals, indicating possible uptrend
items.summary: Seven NSE-listed stocks with market capitalisation above Rs 1,000 crore signalled bullish momentum on 23 December after forming White Marubozu patterns. This candlestick formation reflects strong buying interest throughout the session, suggesting buyers remained in control from open to close and indicating potential continuation of the prevailing uptrend.

items.title: Ambuja Cements among 5 F&O stocks that saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.summary: As of December 23, five stocks in the NSE F&O segment recorded a sharp rise in futures open interest, signalling fresh derivatives activity. A rise in open interest reflects increasing participation, with traders either initiating new positions or expanding existing exposure, pointing to stronger conviction on near-term price direction.

items.title: Coal India shares jump over 1% after in-principle nod for listing of MCL, SECL
items.summary: Coal India share price: In a significant boost for investors, Coal India has seen its shares gain traction after the announcement of plans to list its subsidiaries, Mahanadi Coalfields Limited and South Eastern Coalfields Limited. This strategic initiative aligns with directives from the Ministry of Coal, paving the way for further communications with the Ministry regarding submissions to DIPAM.

items.title: Australia’s Treasury Wine Rises as Billionaire Goudet Buys Stake
items.summary: Treasury Wine Estates Ltd.’s shares jumped about 7% in Sydney, the most since September 2024, after European billionaire Olivier Goudet emerged as a shareholder, offering a rare boost to the troubled winemaker.

items.title: Shriram Finance among 5 stocks closed crossing above VWAP
items.summary: Five Nifty500 stocks closed more than 1% above their VWAP levels on 23 December, indicating strong intraday accumulation and improving market sentiment. A close above VWAP suggests prices strengthened through the session, often viewed as a short-term bullish signal reflecting active buying interest and potential continuation of upward momentum.

items.title: Tata Steel among 5 Nifty stocks showing bullish RSI upswing

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.summary: Spot gold was little changed at $1,929.30 per ounce by 0038 GMT, after falling to a near two-week week low of $1,906.24 on Tuesday.

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: After weeks of consolidation, crude oil has come under pressure amid signs of correction in US equity market and gains in US dollar index.

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
